summary.span: 定义接收和显示墨迹笔划的区域。

span.span: Defines an area that receives and displays ink strokes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 是可用于接收和显示墨迹输入的元素。An is an element that can be used to receive and display ink input. 这通常可通过触笔与数字化器产生墨迹笔画使用触笔或鼠标交互使用。This is commonly done through the use of a stylus, which interacts with a digitizer to produce ink strokes using a stylus or a mouse. 创建的笔画表示为对象，它们可以是以编程方式操作或根据用户输入。The created strokes are represented as objects, and can be manipulated either programmatically or based on user input. 使用户能够修改或删除现有。The enables users to modify or delete an existing . 可以绑定到数据源。The can be bound to a data source. 例如，您可以将绑定属性设置为： 包含手写内容中墨迹序列化的数据格式 (ISF); 甚至可以为 base-64 的、 已编码字符串他人财产的。For example, you can bind the property to: a base-64, encoded string that contains ink data in Ink Serialized format (ISF); or even to the property of another . 此外可以绑定的属性，如和，到其他数据源。You can also bind properties, such as and , to other data sources. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了如何模拟使用笔和荧光笔在同一个。The following example demonstrates how to simulate the use of both a pen and a highlighter on the same . 该示例假定标记语言 (XAML) 文件中的根元素是调用`root`。The example assumes that the root element in the markup language (XAML) file is a called `root`. 它还假定，没有称为`switchHighlighter`并且同时和事件连接到该示例的事件处理程序。It also assumes that there is a called `switchHighlighter` and that both the and events are connected to the example's event handler. remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果此属性设置为`true`，在选中时，墨迹笔画和/或元素四周绘制的装饰器边框。If this property is set to `true`, an adorner border is drawn around ink strokes and/or elements when they are selected. 此边框使用户能够调整所选的对象的大小。This border enables the user to resize the selected objects. 如果是`true`，装饰器使用户能够将笔画和/或元素，以及移动。If is `true`, the adorner enables the user to move the strokes and/or elements as well. 如果此属性设置为`false`装饰器边框在选择了一个或多个墨迹笔画和/或元素时自动删除从所选对象。If this property is set to `false` while one or more ink strokes and/or elements are selected, the adorner border is automatically removed from the selected objects. ## Examples 下面的示例将阻止用户从移动和调整元素大小和上描边。The following example prevents a user from moving and resizing the elements and strokes on a .
